content.label:
Oh my gosh, why is there no way to either stop the intel scrolling on the screen which seems to be non-stop or to slow it down. It actually gives me a headache. Please devs make it so this can be removed. 

I had this game on Samsung Note 10 plus and it didn’t do this, I just switched over to iPhone and the non-stop scrolling of intel information across the screen ruins the game play.

I felt so siked when I learned there was an app for this game. Tropico 3 was my favorite Tropico game back in my gaming days and I was recently thinking about purchasing the game again for PC beforeI discovered the game was available in the App Store at a Walmart on an IPad. Purchased it immediately on my phone. The app makes a lot of improvements on the original game.

needs a much better tool for
creating roads.

title.label: Fun, Addicting, and No in-app purchasing ❤️

content.label: This has become my favorite game. I can strategize and win or lose without having to buy my way to success in the game. I’m a fan and now I want to play on the console or IPad ❤️❤️
Fun game, just hard to see on iPhone.

title.label: Great game overall but needs an update

content.label: I was doing great shooting and arresting random people in my communist state and American decides to invade me and instead of facing off my beast military the game just ends and says game over you were invaded. Please fix this other than that it’s great.

title.label: Full PC game. Old-ish but I love it

content.label:
It’s a great game. I love full PC games on iPads.
Tropico is an amazing game if you like this kind of games.

Would be great to see the new Tropico ported too!

Great game only thing I ask for is more content like let’s us choose to go to war or add to the story and maybe bridges can’t build roads underwater other then that hey this is by far above the curb on builder games and I love it really I play this game everyday all day when I’m off shot sometimes on the job lol I’m  El Presidente!!!! Lol
But I would like to be able to remove rock formations in order to build roads. You Should also have An edit button to where we can rearrange our buildings instead of destroying them.

This game is amazing. Good performance, great gameplay, many laughs, and so fourth. I never thought this game would be cheap as 15$.  This game is not too simple nor hard to master making these game great for many audiences. I love the sandbox and campaign implemented in the game. It’s very hard to hate this game. The only downsides are very minor. Like cars running “down” people, builders and teamsters sometimes(but rarely) taking too long to get to work, and some other minor things. I wish Feral Interactive Ltd would add in more options to building and government policies. Again 5/5, would recommend.
It’s a really good game but it seems like they are not planning to add anything new to it.

This game is really Fun and I would recommend it But the controls is Hard for the view When I Ever want to go to a other View it gets Messes up and Can we Make things move like all the Things move since am new and just got it today I don’t know how to move things.

I have some nostalgic memories of the Tropico series, and it’s great to see it back in full force and on the mobile platform. It’s a brilliant translation and there’s so much content here, it’s hard to believe it works so well. I can keep diving back in over the next few months and always have a solid drip feed of our favorite Presidente. Definitely one of the best games on the App Store, and one of the few sim devs to jump to mobile without getting greedy and over-monetizing (*cough* SimCity). 

If you like sim games at all, this is worth the money.

Love love love Tropico and gameplay works flawlessly on my iPad Pro. One issue though, the scene regularly changes from bright daylight to darker evening to a red color. Even on max brightness, the darker colors are hard to see but the brightest one is too bright. Please work in some option so that we don’t see the lighting change like this. It hurts my eyes and I’m not color blind or visually impaired in any way

name.label: NINJAMES..yeah thats right all you BBers

content.label: The best game ever
Sound only comes through headphones

A great adaptation from the Steam version I own.
Would love to see expansions, or new twists on El Presidente’s domain!
This is one game that I own every release and look forward to more.  I play the iPad version.  Runs well on the Mini 5!
Have other titles by Feral, and they’re all done well for iOS hardware!

title.label: Great Scenarios but offers Sandbox too!

content.label: Great city building game. The scenarios are awesome. The radio announcers are hilarious. The graphics are incredible. Great detail and everything.

Excellent Never made a review about something Like this The game is just like the original the only setback is the winky controls for me, kinda hard to place down roads but overall this game I would consider it a 5 Star although Idk if its me but I havent heard juanito throughout the gameplay, has the port forgotten our favorite TNT broadcaster?

I really appreciate y’all getting Tropico ported to the iPhone, I also would like if y’all can introduce or tease a DLC content either as a free update or a separate, either way it’ll definitely make Tropico even more grander.
If by some ways y’all can bring some  elements from Tropico 6 into this version of Tropico it’ll be awesome, & fun.

This is a great game! I’ve sunk tons of hours into this bad boy and have absolutely no regrets, the interface is flawless and the scenarios are jus the right amount of challenging. I have no regrets about the price tag!

I love Tropico on console and so I had to try this. It’s a very good adaptation with some minor changes for mobile. It works well and is a lot of fun. If you enjoy games like Tropico, cities skylines, or anything along those lines you will love this! It doesn’t have all the fine tuning and options as the console versions but it is an amazing adaptation for mobile!
The game is a fun classic that runs great. I just hate the limited camera, which makes building stuff including roads very frustrating. Everything else is pretty solid.
I don’t write reviews but this game is worth the money, it takes a minute to get used to it but once you get going you can’t put it down.
So glad they didn’t mess with this game. If they had weaseled in some pay to play crap, i would not have bothered, but it’s just amazing as it was the first time i played it many years ago.
An EXTREMELY good port of a good game. This is my go to game for flights and trips on my iPad Pro 12.9. Looking forward to the next Tropico on the iPad.

I give this game a 5 star because feral deserves it for how well they did porting this over. The touch controls are great and the game runs buttery smooth on the latest iPad non pro. That being said it’s basically a port of Tropico 3 which with the recent pc release of tropico 6 is now starting to really show its age. Building selection is limit like it was in the original 3 and the lack of eras gives little to strive for once your economy is humming along. I do hope feral decides to make some dlc with additional buildings in the future. 
All that being said tropico has always filled a cool niche between city builder, island, economy, and dictator sim and feral deserves credit for taking a risk on porting this game to mobile, especially in this era of pay to win mobile gaming.

Got this as soon as it was available for iPhone. I have no complaints and just enjoying being able to play Tropico wherever I go.

Hopefully there will be add-on levels for the game.

title.label: Was Angry now happy oh great port to IOS

content.label:
I paid all this money and now it’s available for iPhone and you want me to pay again to have it on my phone I should be able to download it on both LIKE EVERY OTHER GAME THIS IS BULL

Problem fixed like you guys said iTunes was slow to update I still didn’t hit the purchase that’s why it took a couple days for me to update my review I’ve looked everyday to see if the cloud would pop up instead of the $11.99 and today it did.
My builders won’t build anything
Great game!

title.label: One of the best games for the iPad.

content.label:
I previously wrote a bad review due to battery life but that problem seems to be fixed.

This is one of the best games in the App Store. Works flawlessly on my iPad Pro 11”. Feral hit a home run with Rome: Total War and it seems that they did it with this one too. 

I really really hope to see Medieval 2: Total War, Empire: Total War and Anno 1701/Dawn of Discovery in the App Store one day.
Although the game has great potential it crashes, loosing my progress, even few minutes. It’s so frustrating and I wish I hadn’t purchased it.
Why trópico is suing my location in the background even if I haven’t authorized?

I just bought and downloaded and played a bit, awesome game and wanted to throw my support towards the developer for releasing a REAL game on iOS. Wish tons of people buy this to show support for these kinds of full games on iOS. Knights of the Old Republic is another great port if you want a full game experience without annoying micro transactions, etc. 

Keep up the great work!

This has quickly become my favorite game on my iPad Pro, and it makes what-should-have-already-been-obvious obvious in how to make the iPad a computer gaming device. I’ve really been hoping for a city builder in the vein of SimCity without a handicapped interface, without in-app purchases, without free-to-wait timers…and they really did it. This really is the actual experience that we grew up with, but on today’s platform. 

EA really ought to notice…but they won’t. They’re too busy turning our childhood franchises into casino machines. If this is a harbinger of things to come from Feral, I can’t wait to see what’s next! I’d personally have paid twice as much for such a good game.
Getting better with each update

Been addicted since the very first OG Tropico. I own every game and addition Kalypso and their partnerships have produced.
All I can say is Thank You and well done on this App. 🏆

title.label: Almost as good as the PC version

content.label:
A few minor issues I hope future upgrades fix:

1.)  it seems I can’t upgrade my housing with A/C
2.) No Customs building
3.) wish there were some of the expansion features like The Creamery, Pearl Farms and Plantations

Even with these issues I still play

This has become one of, if not my favorite games on iPad. If you are into simulation city builders this is a must own. The graphics are console quality and the touch controls are spot on. It is a rarity when a PC game comes to iOS and you are not hindered by touch controls. If anything, I feel they enhance this game. The game play is fun and there is a lot of replay value here. 

I have read a lot about crashing and losing saved game data but I have not experienced any of this. I am playing on a brand new iPad Pro 12.9” with the A12x chip so this may have something to do with it. Also, recent updates are aimed at these issues.

The only issue I see is battery drain. If I am playing for longer than 30 minutes I will usually have to plug my iPad into power but this is to be expected with such a graphics intense game. I am pretty surprised they were able to pull this off at all (although I shouldn’t be after seeing what Feral Interactive has done with Tomb Raider on Mac). Great job bringing excellent games to Mac and iOS. Can’t wait to see what is next!
Until it’s stops crashing on basic sandbox play, it will get 1 star from me- you shouldn’t even release games w this many bugs, and surely not for the price they’re asking...

title.label: If the developers are reading this read below

This is the best political simulator I have ever played and crushes all other “political games” on the App Store. Truly amazing and great iPad adaptation!
This won’t work on my iPad. Says you need ios12 to use it. I would like a refund. No use to me.

title.label: Great game, when it's not crashing.

content.label:
Edited 2019-01-15:
The latest version seems to have fixed the crashing. Back up to 5 stars! The dev team has been very responsive.

Original review:
Gameplay is amazing. Artwork is great. Music, spectacular. Why then only two stars?

Because this is the 3rd time in as many days that the game has crashed on me after several hours of play, and since there are apparently no autosaves in sandbox mode, I've lost all my progress.

Fix this bug and it's a 5-star game, 6 if they allowed it.

I have been playing Tropico since it came out on pc. Even played it on the xbox. I love the game.
I would like to see some type of terrain tool. It can be very frustrating when i am trying to create a path though a mountain and I am unable to do so because of the angle of some sections. Also it would be great if i could start out with the flat map and create mountains where I want to instead of the preloaded maps with mountains.

title.label: Love it but crashes too much

content.label:
Love the game... it is really fun, but!!! But!!! It FREAKING CRASHES LIKE ALOT! I have the new I pad pro 2018 12.9 and it crashes a lot especially late game. It got to point where I cant finish the last 3 years of my game because it crashes like every time....... early game never crashes.. mid game it crashed on me once... and in the end game its crashing everytime it autosaves or just out of nowhere... and the worst thing is that it deletes all progress and auto saves.. I have to save the game manually everytime I do something new.... 
One of the first sandbox game mode I played, I didn’t know about the crashing so I didn’t save much... BUT late mid~early late game.. the game crashed and completely erased my entire progress and autosaves...I only had one save file from early game..and I didn’t play the game the whole day “mourning” my loss. I ended started new games afterwards and NOW I’m finding myself saving manually more than I am actually playing the game in fear of losing my progress... please fix this.. I would give this game a 5/5 stars if it didn’t crash every min during the late game. I WANT TO FINISH MY GAME, but i cant cuz its crashes so much!!!!!! PLEASE FIX

title.label: Great until it crashes half way through

content.label: Love this game but it crashed halfway through my first two games and deleted all my saved data when doing so. So be prepared to invest several hours in this game all to unexpectedly have it crash and delete everything before you can finish. It happened during both times during an auto save. Also crashed when I tried to manually save my game and deleted the file. Ridiculous
Just like it was years ago, with improvements.  Wish there were more games like these, no in app purchases, best 12 bucks I ever spent.
In an App Store full of idle tap “simulations” and pay-to-win city builder games, Tropico is a breath of fresh air.
